body:
This post is part of our special coverage South Sudan Referendum 2011.

A referendum is currently taking place in Southern Sudan from 9 January until 15 January 2011 to decide whether or not the south should remain a part Sudan or be an independent state. These are photos documenting Southern Sudan's landmark referendum.

Look at my finger:

[caption id="attachment_185715" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="A woman in Southern Sudan showing off her ink-marked finger after voting. Photo courtesy of Suleiman Abdullahi (http://upiu.com/)"][/caption]

The long walk to vote:

[caption id="attachment_185723" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="The long walk to vote. Photo courtesy of Alun McDonald"][/caption]

New flag of Southern Sudan. The meaning of the colors: Black - the Southern Sudanese people, Red - the blood shed for freedom, Green - the land, Blue - the waters of the river Nile Gold Star - unity of the states of Southern Sudan.

[caption id="attachment_185716" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="The new flag of Southern Sudan. Photo courtesy of Giulio Petrocca."][/caption]

The long wait for freedom:

[caption id="attachment_185740" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="Voters stood in line patiently for hours. Photo courtesy of The International Rescue Committee"][/caption]

Apparently, Southern Sudan TV can't spell Arabic:

[caption id="attachment_185735" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="Southern Sudan TV can't spell Arabic properly: صويت instead of صوت . Photo courtesy of Sate3"][/caption]

How to mark the ballot:

[caption id="attachment_185719" align="aligncenter" width="509" caption="How to mark the ballot in the referendum"][/caption]

Waiting to vote for freedom:

[caption id="attachment_185724" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="Southern Sudanese waiting to vote for freedom. Photo courtesy of David McKenzie"][/caption]

Voting cards:

[caption id="attachment_185734" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="Voting card that Southern Sudanese use to cast votes. Photo courtesy of Usamah"][/caption]

Will you bring a chair for me?:

[caption id="attachment_185739" align="aligncenter" width="600" caption="The line was very long. People brought chairs. Photo courtesy of The International Rescue Committee"][/caption]

This post is part of our special coverage South Sudan Referendum 2011.
